headline: J.D. Vance projected to win GOP Senate primary in Ohio
author: Catherine Garcia
sentences: Vance, a venture capitalist and author of the memoir Hillbilly Elegy, won the Republican Senate primary in Ohio on Tuesday night, NBC News, The New York Times, and The Associated Press project.
With 76 percent of precincts reporting, Vance has 31.4 percent of the vote, followed by Josh Mandel with 24.3 percent and Matt Dolan with 22 percent.
Mike DeWine (R) won the GOP nomination for a second term, with Nan Whaley, the former mayor of Dayton, winning the Democratic nomination.
In November, Vance will face off against Rep. Tim Ryan (D-Ohio), the clear winner of the Democratic Senate primary.
Vance received the endorsement of former President Donald Trump last month.
They are vying to take over the seat being vacated by retiring Sen.
In other Ohio primary news, Gov.
